1.brief: to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
intercession, supplication; by implication, a hymn
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to veil from sight, i.e. conceal (literally or figuratively)

2.brief: to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
to tramp about, i.e. ramble (free or disconsolate)
a contemplation; by implication, an utterance
to make an uproar, or agitate greatly

3.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
properly, to lurk for, i.e. persecute

4.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
fright; concrete, an idol (as a bugbear)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

5.brief: fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

6.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a dove (apparently from the warmth of their mating)
to fly; also (by implication of dimness) to faint (from the darkness of swooning)
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)

7.brief: to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)

8.brief: to hurry; figuratively, to be eager with excitement or enjoyment

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

9.brief: to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)

10.brief: properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)

11.brief: by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to withdraw (both literally and figuratively, whether intransitive or transitive)
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area

12.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

13.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a man in general (singly or collectively)
familiar; a friend, also gentle; hence, a bullock (as being tame; applied, although masculine, to a cow); and so, a chieftain (as notable, like neat cattle)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

14.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to suck, by implication, to relish, or (intransitively) be sweet
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

15.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a temporary abode; by extension, a permanent residence
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)

16.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

17.brief: properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
a light (i.e. window); dual double light, i.e. noon
to ponder, i.e. (by implication) converse (with oneself, and hence, aloud) or (transitively) utter
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

18.brief: to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

19.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

20.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)

21.brief: to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
something buttery (i.e. unctuous and pleasant), as (figuratively) flattery
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to soften (intransitively or transitively), used figuratively
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
something opened, i.e. a drawn sword

22.brief: to throw out, down or away (literally or figuratively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, what is given (by Providence), i.e. a lot

properly, to keep in; hence, to measure; figuratively, to maintain (in various senses)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

23.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cut or split in two; to halve
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
